Package remodel.io

Class Marshaller

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.Marshaller
public class Marshaller
extends java.lang.Object
Marshaller is a serialiser of Java representations of ReMoDeL models. Marshaller is used during the deconstruction and serialisation of an object graph that is being written to a file.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

    Creates a Marshaller.

  • Constructor Details

    • Marshaller

      public Marshaller()
      Creates a Marshaller.

  • Method Details

    • fetchID

      public java.lang.String fetchID​(java.lang.Object object)
      Retrieves the ID code for an object from the objectMap. If the ID was previously stored against this object, returns it; otherwise returns null.
      Parameters:
      object - the Object.
      Returns:
      the ReMoDeL ID code, or null.

    • storeID

      public java.lang.String storeID​(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String id)
      Stores the ID code for an object the objectMap. Stores the ID value against the object key.
      Parameters:
      object - the Object.
      id - the ReMoDeL ID code.
      Returns:
      the ReMoDeL ID code.

    • createID

      public java.lang.String createID​(java.lang.String typeName)
      Creates a unique nodeID for a model type. Creates an identifier from the lower-cased initial letter of the type name, and appends a unique integer index to this. The last index for a given character is maintained in the index Map; this is incremented every time a new identifier is created.
      Parameters:
      typeName - the type name of a model node.
      Returns:
      a nodeID consisting of a lower-case letter and some digits.

    • getTypeName

      public java.lang.String getTypeName​(java.lang.Object object)
      Returns the ReMoDeL type name for any kind of object. If the object is one of the PureCollection collections, returns the ReMoDeL type name (the element-type and brackets) for the collection. If the object is a wrapped basic type, returns the corresponding ReMoDeL type name (in which floating point numbers have the type "Decimal"). Otherwise, returns the simple class name of the object, which is a model node.
      Parameters:
      object - a model node, pure group, or basic value.
      Returns:
      the type name of this object.

    • getPropertyNames

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames​(java.lang.Object node)
      Returns the persistent property names of a given node. Returns the names of the Java fields of the node, in the order these fields were declared. Ignores any fields that are marked transient or static.
      Parameters:
      node - a model node.
      Returns:
      a list of attribute, reference and component names.

    • getProperty

      public java.lang.Object getProperty​(java.lang.Object node, java.lang.String property) throws SemanticError
      Directly fetches the named property of a model node. By reflection, accesses the Java Field declared for the Class of the node, using this to access the node's field value directly.
      Parameters:
      node - the model node.
      property - the property name.
      Returns:
      the property value, as an Object.
      Throws:
      SemanticError - if there is no corresponding Java Field for the property.

    • isAttribute

      public boolean isAttribute​(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests whether a Java object is a ReMoDeL attribute value. Returns true if the object is null, or the simple class name of the object is one of the five basic types.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, possibly null.
      Returns:
      true if this is a ReMoDeL attribute value.

    • isCollection

      public boolean isCollection​(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests whether a Java object is a ReMoDeL PureCollection collection. Returns true if the object is a PureSet or PureList instance, which are the descendants of the abstract PureCollection.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, possibly null.
      Returns:
      true if this is a ReMoDeL PureCollection collection.

    • isBoolean

      public boolean isBoolean​(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests whether a Java object is a ReMoDeL Boolean value.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, possibly null.
      Returns:
      true if this is a ReMoDeL Boolean value.

    • isString

      public boolean isString​(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests whether a Java object is a ReMoDeL String value.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, possibly null.
      Returns:
      true if this is a ReMoDeL String value.

    • isIgnorable

      public boolean isIgnorable​(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests whether a Java object is an ignorable ReMoDeL output. Returns true if the object is a null reference, the Boolean false, or an empty String, PureSet or PureList collection. These values do not need to be written explicitly, since they are constructed by default.
      Parameters:
      object - an object, possibly null.
      Returns:
      true if this is ignorable in ReMoDeL output.
